intro: Oreogrammitis blechnifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on rocks or tree trunks in shaded, moist environments. The plant has delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are usually less than 10 centimeters in length. Its fronds are often clustered and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. Oreogrammitis blechnifrons is found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia and parts of Australia.
